events.title: Hawaiian Forgiveness Meditation and Mantra
events.description: Come sit and be guided through an ancient Hawaiian forgiveness process. Together we will be clearing out preconceptions of how we view others to create new connections and rejuvenated relationships. This is a guided, easygoing and joyful meditation. The Hawaiian word ho‘oponopono comes from ho‘o ("to make") and pono ("right").
events.print_description: With this meditation practice we will be clearing out preconceptions of how we view others to create new connections and rejuvenated relationships.

events.title: *~Sunrise Kickball~*
events.description:
Come play some kickball. Teammates, announcer(s) and cheerleaders needed. 
Prizes and good times awarded to all who participate. No wooks allowed. It is important to make the distinction between a hippie and a wook. Hippies can generally be viewed as positive, optimistic members of society with an idealistic goal for the betterment of society. Wooks are everything that you've been warned about in regard to hippies wrapped into a neat little package. As a side note we may do this more than the days we have listed, if you find yourself up and about, looking for shenanigans around sunrise roll through the 12:00 zone between the man and temple and see if we are there, It's pretty hard to miss a 60' kickball field.

Come play some kickball. Teammates, announcer(s) and cheerleaders needed.

events.title: Aura Painting
events.description:
Grab some tea and join me for an experience driven by Synesthesia, the ability to see and feel color. My practice began as a simple way to relieve stress. I started asking friends if I could paint their auras and came to find that my impressions of color and energy aligned with the individual's current state of being. The process requires a hint of vulnerability and casual conversation. Using oil and chalk pastels I will create an image of the energy you emit.
The process can take 15 to 30 minutes depending on the complexity of the aura. It is my passion to capture the aura in its nautical beauty. 
Upon completion, I give an interpretation of the aura,
events.print_description: I interpret and analyze Auras using oil and chalk pastel.

events.description: BUNCO! Come test your luck at this fast-paced, hilarious dice game. No prior experience necessary -- our hecklers in chief will get you up to speed in no time. events.title: Battle Of Breakfast
events.description: The sun is rising. Your starting to sweat.. your weapon is getting heavy.. you look across the battle field at an alarming amount  of enemys screaming "F*ck your Burn!!". you look at your commander and he seems calm and it calms you. He looks back at his troops. he makes eye contact with you... His mouth turns to a giant smile. you get a chill up your spine. your eyes widen and you feel a serge of adrenaline as you hear your commanders battle cry of "CHARGE". your battalion starts at a full sprint towards the enemy scurge. after the dust clears and the battle is done your remaining battalion and commander sit down for a morning meal in Valhalla...
events.print_description: Dawn your arms and prepare for wave after wave of heritics screaming "fuck your burn!" Then after, enjoy your feast in valhalla with breakfast!!!!!!!!

events.title: Stardust Spa: Self-Service Pampering
events.description: The Stardust Spa at the Stardust Lounge will be open daily between Monday, August 29 and Friday, September 2. Our hours are noon -- 6pm & by appointment. Visitors can pamper themselves with various lotions and creams to rejuvenate their cracked and tired skin; moisture wipes to clean off that brutal dust and dirt of the Playa; comfortable lounge chairs; a cooling breeze from small, hand-held battery-operated fans; and, of course, hydration in the form of delicious cold water.

events.title: Contact Improv : A Meditative Dance Technique
events.description:
Contact Improvisation is a meditative dance technique in which participants use points of physical contact to provide the starting point for exploration through movement. This contact can actually induce the production of a pair bonding hormone, called oxytocin, in the human brain, similar to how you feel when you hug or kiss a loved one. 

Through the sensation of touch and dance, you can explore organic movement generated through and with, one-another, forming new bonds and strengthening old ones.

Accompanied by a variety of musicians, this session will begin with some simple guiding prompts to help individuals become familiar with touching as well as giving/receiving weight. As the jam progresses individuals get to explore movement by listening and responding to their partner/partners through touch. There are no right or wrong answers and you do not need prior dance training to participate. 

The central characteristic of Contact Improvisation is a focus on bodily awareness and physical reflexes rather than consciously controlled movements.  Much like meditation, Contact Improvisational Dance seeks to honor the present moment by guiding the dancers to surrender what is happening now. 

“One learns to recognize and differentiate subtle impulses in our movement choices and our partner's choices. We begin to decipher the cues that we give and receive which tell us when to lead or follow, when to go up, when to go down, where to touch, how to lift, when to slow down, and when to be still. In this form one learns to stay in integrity with each choice, never forcing, never rushing. When Body, Mind, and Spirit are united in their instinctive wisdom one finds ones-self at home in every moment expressing ones true nature.”     

- Moti Zemelman
events.print_description: Through the sensation of touch and dance, we explore organic movement generated through and with, one-another.

events.description:
Dragoncamp Armory will teach women how to make a stunningly sexy metal bikini, while we also offer a bit of body painting on premises for those who would just like a bit of sexy paint decoration. 

Ladies- Learn to trace, cut, and hand hammer a form-fitted bikini aluminum bra and/or bottom. Then decorate with bits and baubles for a one-of-a kind work of art you can wear and share on the playa. We do have limited supplies, so feel free to bring any extra bits of extra costume jewelry or broken bits and baubles to glue on your creation if you wish. Make it as sexy as you dare. Yours to keep! Patterns for all sizes. 

You will need  about 2 hours to complete an outfit. Workshop is 9am-12:30 so please arrive early morning to get started. This is a workshop for women, but partners are welcome to come and encourage.

Pose with our giant Green Dragon art car for a unique photo-op (Dragon-slaying swords furnished). We will e-mail you a photo if you wish.

events.title: "Speed Art Build" by Jimmy Descant, ADA's Guild
events.description:
Jimmy Descant, head artist of the "Amalgamated Debris Assemblage Guild" of Salida, CO. will conduct a special event on Thursday night, 7-9pm, called "The Speed Build" of found object assemblage art. Jimmy and the Guild are masters of turning parts from the Golden Age of American manufacturing into beautiful assemblages.
Audience artist participants thru the week who experience the ADA's booth can put in their name for a lottery to be drawn at 6:30 on Thursdays evening, to be one on 10 chosen artists for this special event. The 10 artists will get a blank board to work on, will choose their own subject matter for the art, and show it to Jimmy at the start of the build. Imagine speed chess!!! where Jimmy will take their suggestion, lay out a few pieces to start and instruct the artist to apply what he did, and as Jimmy works around to the other artists, they add their own vision until Jimmy comes back around, to compound the vision! All other Guild members will help with instruction, tools, and raw materials in this frantic 2 hour filmed creation of 10 unique works of art, finishing with flair and fire into the darkness! As with all created art during the week, the artists rule what happens when done... keep, showcase, give away, burn, gift it...
events.print_description: Speed Art Build by Jimmy Descant, of the "Amalgamated Debris Assemblage Guild" of Salida, CO. will "Speed Build" art with 10 participants Thurs nt 7-9
events.other_location: "Amalgamated Debris Assemblage" , DaVinci Guilds at the Man

events.title: 2016 Black Rock City Air Guitar Championship
events.description:
2016 Black Rock City Air Guitar Championship - Esplanade & 6:45

OFFICIAL RULES OF COMPETITION:  
 	Each performance is played to 1 minute (60 sec.) of a song
 	The 60 second song will be provided to you from a list of 100+ tracks to choose from
 	The instrument must be invisible & be a guitar, i.e. air drums not allowed
 	Air roadies are allowed, but must leave the stage before the performance
 	Back-up bands (air or real) are not allowed

Black Rock City Air Guitar contests each consist of two rounds:

 	Round 1 (freestyle): each competitor performs to a song of their choice from the list
 	Round 2 (compulsory): top competitors from round 1 perform surprise song

JUDGING CRITERIA:  
The jury is a panel of independent judges. The results of the jury cannot be protested. All performances are scored on a scale from 4.0 to 6.0 – 6.0 being the highest possible. Scores are given to one decimal point (e.g. 5.4, not 5.48). A single score is given to each air guitarist based on their overall performance in that round.

The score reflects the quality of the performance based on three key criteria:

1.	Technical merit - You don’t have to know what notes you’re playing, but the more your invisible fretwork corresponds to the music that’s playing, the better the performance.
2.	Stage presence - Anyone can do it in the privacy of their bedroom. Few have what it takes to rock a crowd of hundreds or even thousands – all without an instrument.
3.	“Airness” - The last criteria is the most difficult to define yet often the most decisive of all. Airness is defined as the extent to which a performance transcends the imitation of a real guitar and becomes an art form in and of itself.

Please note: the scores from BOTH ROUNDS are added to determine the contestants’ final scores. This combined score determines the winner.  Earn the title of Black Rock City Air Guitar Champion!
events.print_description: 2016 Black Rock City Air Guitar Championship at Esplanade & 6:45!  Come and watch the spectacle or better yet, enter the competition!

events.title: SHUL: An Ecstatic Dancing Shabbat Morning Service
events.description: SHUL is a new, non-denominational experiment in Jewish ritual and Shabbat celebration. Mingling together old and new spiritual practices, SHUL aims to create a Shabbat service that is accessible, embodied, and fervent. SHUL is prayer + dance, niggunim + bass = a Shabbat morning service that engages all our senses and all our limbs in prayer. Imagine ecstatic dance meets post-Hasidic Hasidim meets inclusive, egalitarian prayer.
events.print_description: Prayer + dance, niggunim + bass = a non-denominational Shabbat morning service that engages all our senses and all our limbs in movement and prayer.

events.description: Human Connection Through Music. Music can have considerable power over all of us. Music is also a universal language that can unite and empower people. Guest DJs and art cars from camps all around the playa will be joining us for this event.

events.title: Diversity at Burning Man
events.description: Diversity at Burning Man: Connecting to the Larger Global Community. Recently, Burning Man has been criticized for its homogeneous population and its increasing income disparity issue. Despite being widely recognized around the world by different ethnic groups, faiths, and sexualities, Burning Man struggles to achieve representative diversity. Disco Chateau celebrates diversity and would like to share inclusion practices that have worked for us, as well as welcome others from different camps to discuss what has worked for them. This talk will invite community leaders to discuss Default World and On Playa empowerment, for a more diverse, inclusive and representative tomorrow.
events.print_description: This talk will invite community leaders to discuss Default World and On Playa empowerment, for a more diverse, inclusive and representative tomorrow.

events.title: Walk of the Wings: Temple Burn Dawn & Midnight
events.description:
We invite participants - especially folks wearing wings, and friends - to gather at the temple on the Sunday of Temple Burn in the hour before dawn (around 5:30-6 AM), to circle the temple in solemn procession as the sun rises around 6:30 AM.  Let's aim for ~15-20 minutes of procession, followed by any additional participation with the Temple you choose. Afterwards we will scatter to share the spirit & purpose of this year's temple.

In perihelion to this event, some of us winged folk will gather again for a night-time circling of the temple, at midnight after the temple burn, around the ashes of the Temple.

Note: The Temple Guardians enthusiastically anticipate this participation, and only ask that we be prepared for them to begin the soft-close of the temple around dawn on Sunday, followed by the firm closure by 8 AM. Parking bikes >500' away from the Temple is requested if you want to stay in the area past 8 AM.

https://walkofthewings.wordpress.com/home
events.print_description: Inviting participants w/ wings (& friends) to gather at the temple on Sunday in the hour before dawn, & @midnight, to circle the temple in procession.

events.title: Self-Compassion
events.description:
Self-Compassion: Connecting with Your Inner Resiliency for Sustainable Personal Growth.

So many of us go through our lives being very hard on ourselves. Leading psychologists indicate that people who are compassionate toward their failings and imperfections experience greater wellbeing than those who repeatedly judge themselves.  This talk will discuss the topic of self compassion and offer attendees techniques to enhance their emotional well being and be more compassionate with themselves in order to sustain long-term personal growth.
events.print_description: Connecting with Your Inner Resiliency for Sustainable Personal Growth.

events.title: Identi-who? Costuming as a Form of Self-Expression
events.description: Identi-Who? | Costuming as a Means of Connecting to Your True Self. Radical self expression is one of the Burning Man’s commandments. And at times we sometimes see the art of costuming as just clothing or something we just wear. This talk will dive in depth on how self-expression plays a critical role into one’s identity and how the playa allows you to truly and radically express yourself. Lead by the Burning Queen herself; Evora Baden will be talking about how costuming, in all forms, allows you to explore your true identity.
events.print_description: This talk will dive into the importance of self-expression and how costuming allows you to explore your true identity.

events.title: Mindfulness/Loving-Kindness Meditation
events.description:
Mindfulness and Loving-Kindness Meditation: Connecting to the Present Moment and Those Around Us. 

Mindfulness is paying attention in a particular way on purpose in the present moment, non-judgmentally. This first part of this experience will focus on practicing mindfulness and bringing a sense of inner calm and peace to participants. The 2nd part of this experience will focus on loving-kindness meditation, a form of meditation that is focused on building a habit of selfless or altruistic love. With compassion-focused meditation, participants will practice loving-kindness towards themselves and friends, family, and acquaintances, even total strangers.
events.print_description: Connecting to the Present Moment and Those Around Us

events.title: Playa Glass: melt dust into black glass jewlery
events.description: What exactly is playa dust? A bunch of metal oxides that, when raised several thousand degrees Fahrenheit, make some amazing black glass. Come and use our welding goggles and Fresnel lenses to melt the playa. We have a jewelry making station where you can mount your glass on a pendant for safe transport back to the default world.
events.print_description: Use our welding goggles and Fresnel lenses to melt playa dust into black glass!  Take your creation back home mounted to a metal pendant.

events.title: Bubbles and Bass Sunrise Parties
events.description: We'll be rockin' you out from 5am til Noon, Wednesday through Sunday mornings, with bubbly bass-tastic house music as you watch the sunrise over the playa and dance the AM hours away... and drink some bubbly while you boogie. We want to create a home of warmth and positive energy during the AM hours. Together with a team of artists, musicians, circus performers, dancers, planners, bartenders, builders, architects, thinkers, dreamers, and lovers, we are going to bring invigorating house music to the Burning Man community and a dance floor that gets everyone moving and shaking. We'll offer you champagne to relax and a comfy chill space to enjoy the sounds while resting your feet. We want to provide an environment conducive to connecting: spiritually, conversationally, and energetically.

events.title: Breaks and Stops for the Chest Hoopers!
events.description:
You got your chest hooping flow down and want to learn some fierce edgy breaks and stops? Come by and I'll show you some simple and impressive combos!
Your hoop has plenty of space for you to move your arms through. Learn how to utilize all of the space of your hoop to break and change direction.
events.print_description: You got your chest hooping flow down and want to learn some fierce edgy breaks and stops? Come by and I'll show you some simple and impressive combos!

events.title: The Singer's Secret Weapon: THE KRACKLE
events.description:
Singers! If you want to build your voice to something magnificent, then you will need the krackle exercise! 'Tis the blood of a strong voice. 
It is not always the most appealing sound, especially for beginners, but sometimes you need to sound ugly before sounding awesome! 
The krackle is the rubbing together of the vocal chords, which gives you immense breath control, builds range, and give the sound extra resonance and brilliance. The krackle will get your voice anywhere you want it to take you. Once your voice has worked through the krackle, then it is ready to be garnished with other beauties, like breathy and flowy goodness. But for now were krackling it up!
events.print_description: Singers! If you want to build your voice to something magnificent, then you will need the krackle exercise! 'Tis the blood of a strong voice.

events.title: SunSets at LED Dinosaur
events.description: LED Dinosaur is THE pre-party destination of 2016.  Come by at dusk for our SunSets.  Have a couple cocktails while you paint our dinosaurs with blacklight paint. To get the night started, our DJs will be playing a fusion of house, classical music, funk, and others.  For the unprepared - we will give the gift of light in the form of LEDs for you to take with you on your journey.  Our guarantee: you will leave for the night properly lit for an epic evening ahead.
events.print_description: LED Dinosaur is THE pre-party destination of 2016.  Come by at dusk for our SunSets.

events.title: Whiskey Wednesday -Coloring with Tom and Jack
events.description:
Ever heard of paint and wine night? Doesn't it sound really boring? Isn't this the 21st century? Michelangelo himself was already getting drunk on wine while painting the Sistine Chapel, that's why he ultimately went blind - or something like that...anyway...

Welcome to the future of fun!! We're going to sip whiskey and color something special with crayons.  We'll be working on one big piece together, so bust out your artistic talent and join Master Artist Tom Varani for coloring with Tom and Jack.

events.title: Recycle Your Aluminum Cans
events.description: Making drinking plans for your camp? Do those plans include lots and lots of cans? Want to unload those empty cans on playa while also helping the city of Gerlach? Well come on down to Recycle Camp and SHOW US YOUR CANS!!!  At Recycle Camp we want all of your ALUMINUM cans as part of our gift to the playa. We are located at 6 and Center Circle behind the Center Camp Cafe and will be open every day until 5pm. No drop offs allowed, when you get there you will help us quickly separate your cans before riding the Crushinator, our magical bicycle-powered can crushing apparatus, to compact the cans so we can store as many as possible before scrapping the aluminum off-site. All of the money we generate from can recycling is donated to the Gerlach school system. We only accept aluminum cans so please keep all of your soup or heavy metal cans. If you are unsure if it is aluminum a good rule of thumb is if you can't crush it, then we don't want it. Also, some stout beers like Guinness also have a plastic widget that cannot be recycled with the aluminum, please remove of be conscious of it before bringing them to us. PROTIP from the Recyclenauts: bring a MESH bag to store all of your cans in. Plastic bags won't allow your cans to dry out, so please store them in a mesh bag before bringing them over to Recycle Camp and help make things a little less juicy for us when we crush them. Be smart, plan ahead, Recycle Camp wants YOU to come CRUSH it with us!!! We are CLOSED ON MONDAY, plan ahead!

events.title: What are those 5Rhythms anyway? w/Aaron Lifshin
events.description: Just like light, sound, or ocean waves, a dancing body moving freely passes through five distinct rhythmic patterns. These patterns continuously repeat themselves in a wave of motion. Gabrielle Roth's 5Rhythms® are: FLOWING – the fluid, continuous, grounded glide of our own movements; STACCATO – the percussive, pulsing beat that shapes us a thousand different ways; CHAOS – the rhythm of letting go, releasing into the catalytic wildness of our dance that can never be planned or repeated; LYRICAL – the rhythm of trance, where the weight of self-consciousness dissolves, where we lighten up and disappear into our own uniqueness; and STILLNESS – the quiet emptiness, where gentle movements rise and fall, start and end, in a field of silence. Please join Aaron Lifshin for an introduction to the 5Rhythms movement practice, at RhythmWave.
events.print_description: Please join Aaron Lifshin for an introduction to the 5Rhythms movement practice, at RhythmWave.

events.title: Yoga Mala: 108 Sun Salutations
events.description: One to the first power, times two to the second, times three to the third: That's 108, the number of beads on a Buddhist prayer string and the number of sun salutations in this devotional, meditative, and spiritual yoga practice. Come join us at the Man on the day he burns, facing the rising sun on the deep playa side, for some joyful time spent moving our bodies and breathing together. No need to be scared by the number 108! The point is to breathe and to be, and the practice will be scaled to everybody and all bodies, including those that have never done yoga before! Join us to honor a beautiful community and to welcome a beautiful new year. Everybody welcome.
events.print_description: Come practice a yoga mala: 108 meditative and devotional sun salutations performed at sunrise on the day the Man burns. Scaled to all bodies!

events.title: The Impossible Breakfast
events.description:
At Roko's Basilica we like to question the impossible and this one topic has torn our community for too long. "Experts" think it's physically impossible to crack an egg with ones butt cheeks. We are tired of listening to experts!  Here at Roko's Basilica we achieve the impossible. 

Come one, come all for the breakfast showdown of a lifetime. We will prove to the world that not only is it possible to crack an egg with one's butt but we will host a competition for who can crack the most eggs and make breakfast out of them!  Whoever can successfully crack an egg will get the victory breakfast with nothing less than your accomplishment for all to envy in glory. 

Anyone and everyone is encouraged to join in this historic, scientific and breakfast related breakthrough. Eggs will be provided, let's get cracking!
events.print_description: "Experts" think it's physically impossible to make breakfast using your butt cheeks to crack eggs, we beg to differ.  Let's get cracking!

events.title: The Dream Society Aster)*( Dome
events.description:
We Dream Together
We are all dreamers, there is no other
We share a dream that spans space and time.
We ignite the dreamer within us, lighting up new ideas. 
We connect hearts, bodies, minds with our passionate pursuits, mobilizing movements with our community.

Dreamers do because we love.
The Dream Society creates the experience of the shared dream, seeding inspirations for each other. We share joyfully.
We care for ourselves and reach out to each other in this ongoing process of self-tuning and collaborative alignment. We hone each other by being honest with each other, seeking to be our best by reflecting the best in each other.
Our space is dedicated to collaborative dreaming. In this society, our shared dreams create reality.

We begin by transmitting open space for exploration.
Through play, song, poetry, light, art, science and discovery we explore timeless wisdom, rhythm and the beat of a shared signal.
We create nourishment for each other and experiment with tools for wellbeing to enhance our abilities together.
Dreamspace happens when we come together and share passions. The society we share is decentralized, open and available to participation. Our place is open as sanctuary to lucid dreamers and explorers from all walks.
The dream becomes more intricate and real as we weave ourselves together in vast experiences, a dreamcatcher mandala of jeweled moments tied together through our people.
Our shared dream becomes a sparkling dance of culture creation, improvising to flow with the surreal systems around us to create the world we want to live in.

Our dreamspace is open to share.
We invite you to relax and dive deep within the Dream Society to amplify and transmit your vision with others.
Dance, create, flow, love and be yourself in the shared dance of culture creation. In this play we become both the dreamers and the dream of who we want to be, in this world, together.
events.print_description: Your tranquil home to relax, journey and dream about our shared society to the sound of curated poetry, philosophy, storytelling, readings and dreams

The Hawaiian word ho‘oponopono comes from ho‘o ("to make") and pono ("right").

events.title: Chakra Breathing Meditation
events.description: OSHO was a self-development guru who designed active meditations to amplify, release, and and re-activate. In this standing breathwork we’ll take deep breaths in and out through the mouth, sending oxygen into the body’s main energy centers. This activates and cleanses the whole mind/body system and can be quite healing when done with determination. Nick Meador customizes the meditation a bit, bringing in tips and wisdom from study in a variety of awareness and healing modalities.

events.title: Dynamic Meditation
events.description: Self-development guru OSHO designed active meditations to amplify, release, and and re-activate. The Dynamic Meditation is his most intense experience, involving a breath of fire, intentional madness, hopping, chanting, and total stillness. Face your demons head-on and you will reap the rewards. What better place to go a little crazy than Black Rock City? Nick Meador is fully trained to hold the container for you to go deep and have a transformational experience.

events.title: Cacao Ceremony
events.description: In this sacred circle we will imbibe the indigenous plant medicine cacao, grown organically in northern Guatemala by a farmer Nick Meador knows personally. Pure cacao opens the heart, deepens meditative experiences, and fosters inner/outer connection. We’ll have an opening circle to support each other with intention for the burn, then take a journey of interaction with ourselves alone, with another person, and with the whole group. After this holistic experience for mind, body, and spirit we’ll come back together for integration.
events.print_description: In this sacred circle we will imbibe pure cacao, which opens the heart, deepens meditative experiences, and fosters inner/outer connection.

events.title: Symbiogenesis: Evolution & future biology of Earth
events.description: Symbiogenesis is the process by which groups of organisms merge into more complex meta-organisms. It is the process that lead to the evolution of complex cells and all macroscopic life. As a pattern, Symbiogenesis points the way to how we might design a human civilization that is so interconnected with other livings organisms that our buildings and cities become living, breathing, reproducing meta-organisms themselves, ushering in a new age in the evolution of the world-body.
events.print_description: Symbiogenesis is the process by which groups of organisms merge into more complex meta-organisms.

events.title: Sometimes Losing It all, Gives you everything?
events.description: At this point, my husband and I decided to take stock, stop time and start living.  We have been working and living remotely for 15 months.  We've been to ashrams, meditation centres, Iceland, Vietnam, Cambodia, started a business in India, and met the most incredible people.  Currently, we're living in our RV touring north America before heading to Africa to work with a non profit we've been working with remotely (Pro bono work on their business operations).

events.title: Building Ethical Institutions:  Is it Worth a Try?
events.description: Experiencing the capacity to build institutions that incorporate our values can be profoundly liberating.  But this can also be all-consuming.  Is there something inherent in building institutions that is inconsistent with joy and freedom?  This talk is a group conversation that examines the journey of successfully creation of institutions that embody our values and whether so doing can help us to actualize "a more beautiful world our hearts know is possible, or whether there are pitfalls inherent to institution-bulding that should be avoided altogether by the light-hearted amongst us.

events.title: FOMO: Impacting decision making for centuries.
events.description:
"The fear of missing out (FOMO) is a new name for a concept deeply embedded in human nature: that by choosing to do something we're going to miss out on something else that is even better.  In cognitive psychology FOMO is known as loss aversion.  Loss aversion refers to people's tendency to strongly prefer avoiding losses to acquiring gains. Most studies suggest that losses are twice as powerful, psychologically, as gains.  Basically FOMO is the losing out on what others are currently experiencing and valuing it higher than the gain of your current experience.  An early example of FOMO comes from Tulipmania in Holland in the 1590s.  Seeing and hearing others buy into the promises of tulip profitability encouraged others to do the same. Nobody wanted to be the one missing out. 

When you lose something it hurts and often to avoid this negative emotion strange behavior may occur. This talk will give insight into why FOMO occurs and illustrate that it happens not only to Millennials anxious about what experiences their peers are having, but also to those making business and investment decisions.
events.print_description: Come explore how the fear of missing out (FOMO) and how it manifests in cognitive psychology, investment decisions, and personal relationships.

events.title: LIP-SYNC Battle
events.description:
ATTENTION ALL SICK CUNTS & SUPERSTARS!!!
One of the most highly anticipated events of the Burn and the Camp Anita schedule 
For those that don’t know, lip-sync battle is basically karaoke but without any singing, just you and a mic (turned off) and the platform to perform your heart and soul out to your favourite song.
Get creative, get inspirational, wear a costume or just belt out a classic ballad. If this sound like something you will enjoy (or would be a great opportunity to step outside your comfort zone) sign up to the Lip-sync Battle 2016.
Space is limited, so register early at Camp Anita! Bring your song on an USB or MP3 player. Ask for Tim or Verity!
For some inspiration watch the teaser video from PapaZahns (Camp Anita’s Sister Camp) at this years Blazing Swan (Western Australian Regional Burn) in the URL link provided.

events.title: Project Prayer Song Recording Event
events.description:
We’re creating a “digital world choir” out of human beings from across the planet, and from all walks of life, regardless of race, religion, nationality or social status. What does that mean exactly? It means that we’d love to use YOUR voice alongside tens of thousands (or more) of other people just like you from around the globe for use in a song. A song that’s written for everyone. But more importantly, we’re creating an inspiring new story as part of a full length feature documentary… a story that we’d like you to be a part of.

Project Prayer Song is about creating something bigger, collectively, than any of us ever could by ourselves. Our intention is to paint a picture of some of the challenges we face as human beings, and to unite singers, musicians and everyday people from around the globe to demonstrate through music and film, that we can create incredible beauty if we work together.

events.title: Slippery Vulvas - A Soapy Workshop
events.description:
It is our pleasure to host you at Slippery Vulvas! Today we'll be carving beautiful and varied vulvas out of pink soap in this live workshop space open to all genders. Promoting eye-opening (and leg-opening) dialogue on the many different forms of this tucked away treasure. We're talking innies, outties, bald vulvas, hairy vulvas, groomed vulvas, asymmetrical vulvas, layered vulvas, big vulvas, small vulvas . . . just like a fingerprint no two can ever be the same! The assortment really is amazing.

Inspired by Australian artist Greg Taylor's exhibition entitled The Great Wall Of Gina displaying 151 life size porcelain sculptures along a 130ft wall at the MONA in Hobart, Australia. In the gift shop of the museum they sell soaps that are a replica of these moulds, but on Playa we will be the artists! 

Who will be your muse?
events.print_description: Carving beautiful and varied vulvas out of pink soap. Promoting a dialogue on the different forms of this tucked away treasure. Who will be your muse?

events.title: Gonzo Communications: Hunter Thompson & Activism
events.description: Based on the book "Dear Dr. Thompson:  Felony Murder, Hunter S. Thompson and the Last Gonzo Campaign" about my work with gonzo journalist Hunter S. Thompson to free a young woman from prison for a crime she obviously did not commit. This talk illuminates another side of the author as an activist--not about the guns and drugs. This is an educational talk about why America should abolish the Felony Murder statue which can hold people accountable for crimes they had no intention of committing. But most importantly it is about the lessons I learned from Hunter Thompson as his colleague and how a simple letter can change a person's life.
events.print_description: Why America should abolish the Felony Murder statue which can hold people accountable for crimes they had no intention of committing.

events.title: Ask Yourself: Getting your own answers

And how can we be constantly evolving yet peaceful in our self trust? Jenna only found her answers when she began asking questions. And never taking anyone else's word for it.

It doesn’t matter if you’re a complete novice who’s never tried it in your life or an experienced fighter, come along and experience this amazing bonding experience in Gymnasium, Black Rock City’s Ancient Greek wrestling school!

events.title: Naked Philosophy
events.description: Nudity has the power to surprise and shock, yet why, on reflection, can something as mundane as the naked body inspire simultaneously so much passion and revulsion? To be naked in 21st century western society demands intense self-examination, the questioning and reappraisal of conventional conventions and morality. In this sense, naturism, as the cultural and political movement of nudism is often known, is an inherently philosophical practice. And what better way to do philosophy than naked? We’re sure your college seminars would have been much more fun nude. Come and join us for lively discussions, debates and story-telling. We’ll be discussing naturism, body image, sharing experiences, debating body modification, if and how laws should be changed – really everything related to the human body.
events.print_description: Nudity has the power to surprise and shock, yet why, can something as mundane as the naked body inspire simultaneously so much passion and revulsion?

events.title: Witnessing/Holding Sacred Space
events.description:
Witnessing/Holding Sacred Space: Adventures in Exhibitionism/Voyeurism. 
Sharing erotic self-touch (Masturbation) as observer and observed.
Bring a towel and a favorite lube.
Many of us received the message that experiencing pleasure – especially erotic pleasure – is wrong. Even when we learn later in life that is good, we can still experience shame. Nothing is better for shame than confronting it. This workshop gives participants the opportunity to alternate roles as exhibitionist and voyeur in groups of three. The voyeurs job is to hold a sacred non-judgmental space for the exhibitionist. The exhibitionists job is to let go of shame and give themselves over to erotic pleasure, knowing they have permission and are supported by their voyeurs.
events.print_description: Sharing erotic self-touch as observer and observed.

events.print_description: Schoolyard games, apple juice, PBJ, and great 'tunes

events.title: Tantra Connection Puja
events.description: "A Puja is a devotional offering. In this sacred ceremony we will take off the protective masks we often wear to discover a deep connection with ourselves, our fellow humans, and to life itself. We will be guided through vulnerable, heart opening and playful exercises, rotating to explore with different partners in a safe way. Experiences may include questions, PG touch, breath, and the healing power of being truly seen and heard with unconditional love. You may find there are ways you hold yourself back out of fear, and this will give you an opportunity to open to more freedom so that you can connect to others with trust and joy, celebrating everyone including yourself as a reflection of the divine.
events.print_description: Celebrate yourself and others as the divine through heart opening and playful exercises, rotating to explore with different partners.

events.title: Burning Camp Mazu Workshop
events.description:
Our theme camp work shop includes bua-buei ,message ,talisman and fortune stick.
Bua buei"
Bua-buei means throwing divine blocks.
Buei blocks are very common divination tools in Taiwanese temples,which are used in pairs and thrown to get a yes or no answer from gods.
They are made out of wood and carved into a crescent shape.Each block is round on one side (known as the Yin side) and flat on the other (known as the Yang side).
When throwing the blocks, there are three possible results: One block flat and another block round is a ‘yes’ answer.Both blocks flat is a “maybe” answer. Both blocks round is a ‘no’ answer.
​
"Fortune Sticks"
During a ritual, the querent will light an incense,
Bua-buei and accompanied by drawing fortune sticks to clarify an oracle.
​
"Talisman"
We will use talismanic stamp or giving an amulet to participant for good health and good luck.
The participant can get inked by a  Burning Mazu talismanic stamp, then enter ouracupressure massage dome.
events.print_description: Our Mazu theme camp is located at 8:00 Guild ,unique oriental activities are awaiting   .Our workshop will be at 3-6pm 7-10pm from 8/30 to 9/4,welcome

events.title: Camp Yes Please Wearables Workstation
events.description: Need help with your radical self-expression? Did your latest dust-up result in a rip, tear, or busted seam?  Do you just want to be creative for a while? Come on down to Camp Yes Please at 8:15 & D, have a drink and get crafty with us. Whether you need a needle and thread, safety pins, a fabric patch, or hot glue, our F-it box has supplies you need to Fix or Finish your damaged or not-quite-playa-ready outfit. Or rummage through our treasure chest of trinkets to create your own playa-inspired jewelry. Our box is open anytime, and help is given to those who ask.

Have a drink, enjoy some shade and fabulous music, and breathe new life into your tips and toes.  We have everything you need to make your tootsies sparkle and shine.

events.title: Burn2 Regional Burners Meetup on the Playa
events.description:
WHO from our regional in Second Life is heading to the real BM Black Rock City -home?  We will meet at Camp Everywhere (AKA Everywhere Pavilion) on Wednesday at 6 PM sharp (the 'sharp' part to be determined).

After a bit of a mingle we will head out to near Center Camp within webcam range (7 PM or before we run out of daylight!).  We will unfurl the banner and catch the webcam's attention for the world and those of us watching back at our other home on the virtual playa in Second Life.

For those wanting to stick around we have unofficial plans to drop in on Black Rock Beacon afterwards.

Stay tuned for updates (or location changes... you do know they happen!)
events.print_description: WHO from our regional in Second Life is heading to the real BM Black Rock City -home?  We will meet at Camp Everywhere on Wednesday at 6pm sharp!

events.title: The psychology of attraction
events.description: This talk will dive into the psychology behind attraction, lust and desire. Understand what you're doing (and not doing) in the dating and mating game and how you can hack the system... and your own attractiveness. Attraction is something you can hack. By learning the psychology behind how and who we are drawn to, we can make small shifts (from our body language to mastering the different kinds of eye gaze) and become more attractive.

events.title: Savage 3D Audio Performances
events.description:
Experience live music the Savage way - in 3D!!! Music Savages Camp is excited to transport you to the future - where the beats and sounds and rhythms will come from all dimensions. The Savage Arena is outfitted with 16 speakers, mounted around the perimeter and above the dance floor - all facing inward. And at the center, our performers will take control of their music, sending sounds to all reaches of space. 

Are those crickets on the playa??? No... bugs were so last year. Is that a train coming through my tent??? No.. while we would like to make a train, the tracks could be problematic for bikers without headlamps. Is that a spaceship landing in a daybed??? maybe... but you're probably just hearing things from the future... SAVAGE 3D. It's here. 

Oh.. and we have cool lights.
events.print_description: Experience live music the Savage way - in 3D!!! With 16 speakers around and above the dance floor, it'll be like you're hearing for the first time!

events.title: Why Hollywood wants you to get married
events.description: Consensual non-monogamy heavily questions the traditional paradigm on relationships. But who is the fiercest and most successful advocate of traditional relationships? Hollywood, that since we are kids and throughout our entire life feeds us with happy endings that inevitably evolve around a couple finally being together. In the past few years, though, it seems like Hollywood is considering nontraditional relationships as well. Can we trust the studios, or should we question them?

events.title: Heroes & Super Villains Soul Brunch
events.description:
Soul Brunch isn't just a party; it's like the backyard barbecues of home. It's like the cookouts of our yesteryears. As your families invited your communities over, as the generations of soul families invited their communities over, so too does the Heroes & Super Villains family invite the Playa community over to eat together, drink together, get to know one another, dance with each other and uplift each other. From noon until sunset, our trained chefs serve up the freshest breakfast burritos on the Playa, accompanied by professionally made craft cocktails. Our collection of international DJs spin smooth beats until nightfall.

We also give revelers a chance to clean up with our Soul Power Showers; guests experience the rebirth and rejuvenation of cool, cleansing water sprayed forcefully from our pressurized washer system (imagine a water saving car wash inside our shower areas for guests). Baptised anew, heroes set out on their way spreading positive vibes.

On it's 11th Annual Celebration of the Soul Brunch, we were gifted curated sounds from Marques Wyatt, Paul Geddes, Deep Wood, Rafael de la Cruz, David Kiss, Big Daddy & more!



https://www.amplfy.me/video/oQDJKzBew
events.print_description: Music, Breakfast Burritos & drinks make this the best Friday on the Playa!

events.title: LipBomb
events.description:
"Where must we go, we who wander this wasteland, in search of our better selves?" 

To LipBomb dammit! Join us for our Thursday Day Party. By now you should finally have your shit together, so come celebrate your new beginning with new friends. Enjoy dirty, dusty beats, cold drinks and draft beer from the wasteland bar we raided. 

"I like this plan... we could start again, just like the old days!"
Max: "Look, it'll be a hard day. But I guarantee you that a hundred and sixty days ride that way... there's nothing but salt. At least that way we might be able to... together... come across some kind of redemption."

events.title: Samasati Meditation
events.description: Samasati means awareness or consciousness. The purpose of this meditation is to bring awareness to the denial and fear people have regarding death. The goal of this meditation is to practice the art of witnessing rather than reaching to situations and circumstances. Be aware and remember that since you are alive, you must not take your life for granted. Choose the position: 'I will always value my life.' Appreciating my life means waking up every morning and looking into the mirror, and saying to myself, 'I am so happy to be alive!' Thank you Osho, for helping me to create this meditation." I designed this meditation so that it can be done in a group or by yourself. The first six stages are an oppertunity to practice dying consciously, a rehearsal for the end of your life. The remaining four stages are a reminder to live totally and cherish each moment.
events.print_description: Bring awareness to the denial and fear regarding death. The art of witnessing rather than reaching to situations and circumstances.

events.title: Shamanic Journeying with the Breath
events.description: Now is the time to wake up to our ability to heal ourselves, to be the guru, healer, and being of light that we are are and choose to express that in our current reality. As we heal our nervous system of the trauma and pain accumulated from the experience of learning in our human bodies, we create a space for expansion and connection. We summon you all to hear the call within you, stand in courage, and bravely face down your pain and trauma and emerge whole and fully expressed as an innocent, fearless, loving, joyous being. We recognize that it is important to be respectful of indigenous cultures and practices when using the term "Shaman". The Ceremony leaders do not consider themselves to be Shamans, yet we find it is the best way to describe the ritual being used in this healing ceremony so we feel good about using this term to describe the practice, not the leaders. Shamanism is the practice of inducing trance in order to achieve a state of non-ordinary reality in order to communicate with the source energy that flows through all of life, healing spirits, animal spirit guides, angels, and ancestors. This practice also calls upon the elemental forces for cleansing and healing of mind, body, and spirit. Pranic Journeying takes us into a place of non-ordinary reality where deep release of mental, emotional, and physical blocks may occur. In this state we are open to receive deep esoteric truths, connect with our helping spirits and ancestors, and merge with our higher self and higher consciousness. The journey is unique based on the individual although the group undergoes a unique journey together as well. Each journey can be very different as the healing intelligence of spirit knows just where to take us to safely clear the energy in alignment with our intentions. There are many ways to induce a shamanic trance: drumming, dancing, singing, ingesting plant medicine and breath work. In this course we are using a form of breath work we call “Healing Breath” which is s

events.title: Terror & Romance, a Relationship w/ the Unknown
events.description: An emotional ambiguity so loud it can’t be ignored, the Terror and the Romance of the Unknown create an experience we call Holy, or Divine. events.title: Cultural Appropriation? Let's talk about it!
events.description:
Let's have a heart felt community conversation to reflect on our actions. To examine how to work towards right relationship with cultural traditions that aren't of our personal ancestry. 

•  Adornments and Healing Arts? Rituals & Spiritual Practices? Permaculture & Herbal Medicine? By engaging openly with sacred cultural traditions, are we unknowingly re-colonizing and harming oppressed people and cultures? (Cultural Appropriation). 

•  Do we know the true history of these traditions and peoples? Are they being oppressed? Are we benefiting? What questions can we ask ourselves? What can we do? 

 • What does it mean to decolonize ourselves and why is it important to talk about it? 

•  What hole are we seeking to fill? What is it about mainstream consumerist culture and our own histories of immigration, assimilation, and struggle that leave us seeking connection and wisdom from indigenous cultures?

Let’s reflect deeply from a place of love. Let's ask ourselves and each other these questions. Let's learn from the many resources available and talk about these complex issues that affect us all. Isn't it our shared responsibility to move towards right relationship for peace and freedom for all beings. Let's have these conversations ongoing, on and off the playa. Would love to see you!
events.print_description: How do we engage with the world’s cultural traditions? Are we respectful and conscious with these sacred practices and/or un-knowingly causing harm?

events.title: Contraexpression — Poetry of the Body
events.description:
Do you want to experience poetry of the body while hardly moving at all? 
　 　 
Contraexpression is not anti-expression, passivity; it’s 'contrary-expression' of any expressive stimulus, and it’s irresistible. 
　 　 
There is no wrong way to do this. 
　 　 
In the experience, you will be guided through a passage in which you find your own way of moving the body.  I don’t ask anyone to move their body in a rhythm, nor engage bodies, nor expect that all the people do the same action. People don’t need to follow a pattern or imitate; it’s experiential. 
　 　 
I give directions based on trust in the body, and what it can manifest. The person will discover how to adapt these directions to their understanding and needs. Maybe someone can move rapidly, maybe another can move slowly, or hardly at all — each one with their own development and course of action. 
　 　 
This workshop focuses on the method of “The Unknown Theater” (El Teatro Desconocido) directed by Juan Carlos De Petre and developed over forty years by a group of people concentrated on exploration of subtle expression. 
　 　 
The practice reveals knowledge; we start from the consciousness of not-knowing — ignorance is the beginning. 
　 　 
This knowledge is experimental and creative; not intellectual, preconceived, acquired through repetition, or memory. Participants will work as a unique being, independent, and according to their own development. You can overcome intimidation and shame; discover empowerment, physical malleability, and grace.
　 　 
Open the door to your body to express the unimaginable. 
 　　 
#clothing optional #nudist #naturist
events.print_description: Do you want to experience poetry of the body while hardly moving at all?

events.title: Copassion: A Permanent Workshop — Nuptias
events.description:
We invite you to this workshop wedding, a wedding ceremony in real time, vows in conversation. 
　　
Be witnesses and contributors to a dialogue that began with a question: Can a couple be more free together than they can be apart?  To answer this it was necessary to find a new comprehension.  And we found a way that we call Copassion — our employer, a permanent workshop, a commitment to listen, follow change, a hermetic container for creation. 
　　
#clothing optional #nudist #naturist
events.print_description: We invite you to this workshop wedding, a wedding ceremony in real time, vows in conversation.

events.title: Morphic Field Movement
events.description:
This practice is not dance, body expression, theater, nor performance — it is a composition of these, and more. 
 　　 
As human beings we are prepared to communicate with new languages. We will use the intelligence of the movement to communicate. You can move being encouraged and guided by the intelligence of morphic fields (Rupert Sheldrake has published credible research about this). 
 　　 
A morphic field is a field of energy that stores information; in the field exist dynamics, settings, games, processes; it is a memory field, it is an intelligent field. A morphic field is created when any of us introduces an intention and an action in space and time, which after being performed several times becomes a specific intelligence, then that intelligence influences the actions of a whole group and creates a memory of a way of doing things. In a morphic field the communication is easy and instantaneous. 
 　　 
Morphic Field Movement becomes physical expression, borne from body languages, from the poetry of the body, from the clear expression of the bodies. 
 　　 
What I would like to explore is the possibility to express more subtle dimensions of communication, more rare to our usual life; communicating realities that words can not name and the body can reveal. Morphic Field Movement is a proposal to create another type of communication — alternative now, and I hope definitive and more popular in the future.　　 #clothing optional #nudist #naturist
events.print_description: This practice is not dance, body expression, theater, nor performance — it is a composition of these, and more.

events.title: BRC Pride Parade
events.description:
Meet up at CampProper to start the annual 2016 Lesbian, Gay, Transgender, Queer, Intersex, Asexual, and Ally Pride Parade! It's going to be FABULOUS! 

The parade will start at our camp with some dancing. We expect to start the parade around 4:00pm (but, the party starts at 3pm). From there, we will follow a path around the 7:30 sector growing and collecting more people as we go. The parade will eventually end up at the Man, where we will take over the space with our inclusive fabulousness! Come read to walk, bike, dance, and just be amazing. Art cars are welcome to join!

events.title: Dusty Connection- Teahouse & Connection Experience
events.description:
Would you like to be famous? What do you feel most grateful about in your life? When did you last sing to yourself?

Join us in the cosy Bedouin-inspired surrounds of the Dusty Connection, where you can connect with old friends or make new ones while sipping delicious mint tea and perusing our menu of soul-searching questions. This is a cuppa like no other, as the questions are designed to cut  through small talk, instigate deep connection, and get to the heart of what really matters to us. 

After a night of wild partying, this is the perfect place to wind down and warm up under some cosy blankets.

events.title: Nordic Midsommar Party!
events.description:
Nordic burners are bringing our favorite celebration of the year to playa: Midsommar!
===
There are infinite ways of enjoying Midsommar – and your way is the true way. Wrap yourself up in what will be a party of surreal levels of myth and ancient Viking traditions, or just enjoy what seems to be a pretty straight forward kids’ party for grown-ups celebrating fertility. 


There will be enigmatic traditional dancing, confused games, and drinks that will make you sing songs of tales long forgotten. And it will all take place below the 30 feet tall fertility penis, err, maypole, which will watch over us all and make us fertile as all fuck.


For an optimal midsummer celebration and a magical night, you must find 7 flowers in our camp to dream of your future love, do the traditional frog dance, and drink an absurd amount of schnapps!


For an optimal midsummer celebration and a maxed out magical night you will need to find 7 kinds of flowers in our camp, which will make you dream of your future love. Last but not least, there will of course be spaced out frog dancing and an absurd amount of snaps!


If the party gets too weird, you can also have a ‘fika’ to see we have more conventional customs as well.


The party will take place at the Northern Light Camp 3.15 & Florian Thursday 4.


Maypole dance and games will take place between 4 and 6pm. 


Lots and love, flowers, rainbows and fluffy greetings,

The Northern Lights Camp
events.print_description:
Our favorite celebration of the year on playa: Midsommar

Mystic traditional dancing, games, and drinks around a non-traditional Midsommar Maypole!

events.title: Yogananda Energization and Prayer for World Peace
events.description: Together let us become “Awake and Ready” with Paramhansa Yogananda’s Energization Exercises & Prayer for world peace.  Prepare your mind and spirit for another uplifting day on the Playa!  Yogananda claimed the purpose of exercise was to awaken an inner energy source.  His series of energization exercises were designed to bring both energy and calm.  The exercises “purify the bloodstream and recharge every cell with cosmic energy.” The aim is to gain increased awareness and control over your life force and to identify more with the soul than the body.  This event happens just before yoga and meditation at Buddha Camp and is a great way to wake up and prepare your body and mind for those sessions.  All the exercises are done from a standing position and anyone, regardless of fitness level, can benefit.  Following the exercises we will repeat together, Yogananda's Peace and Harmony Prayer for World Peace.  This event is 30 minutes long.  Come join us!

events.title: Cosmic Chanting
events.description:
You probably know the Beatles song Tomorrow Never Knows, 
but you may not know that it was based on the Tibetan Book Of The Dead and that John Lennon imagined it as having thousands of monks chanting in the background. 

At this Temple event we will have everyone chanting Om Mani Padme Hum together for a while, then singing Tomorrow Never Knows along with the chant.  I have recorded a backing track for this event, so it is easier for us all to stay together in tempo and pitch, plus as a reminder for the song lyrics. But the most important audio at the event will be your voice!
events.print_description: We will chant Om Mani Padme Hum together and then combine it with "Tomorrow Never Knows", the Beatles song about the Tibetan Book Of The Dead.

events.title: Release & Receive Workshop
events.description:
"The root of all suffering is attachment." - Buddha 

As humans, we like to grasp....everything. Things, people, ideas, beliefs, emotions, the past, the future. If it is within our reach, we want it, we want control of it and we don't want to let it go. 

Unfortunately our attachments often become a roadblock on our journey of life, preventing us from living as the fullest and most beautiful expression of who we are. 

Join us for a conscious conversation around attachment and learn tools to finally RELEASE what is not serving you. Through this process of releasing, we open our hands, our minds and our hearts to the universe and RECEIVE all of her glory 🙏❤️
events.print_description: Join us for a conscious conversation around attachment and learn tools to finally RELEASE what is not serving you.

events.description:

In this workshop we will deal with those questions, experience different types of touch, define our boundaries and learn to communicate them to the people around us, while respecting their boundaries.
The workshop is for men and woman over 18 (not teenagers and kids) and will include nudity.

events.title: Facials at Hotel California
events.description:
Take a break from the playa dust, sun and sweat and come on in for a wonderful, relaxing 25-minute facial!

Lie down on on a giant pillow, listen to the music, and close your eyes… We will clean your dusty face, apply a cool sheet mask soaked in one of our handmade, natural and organic lotions, massage your skin with a soothing oil and sunscreen, add awesome metallic freckles to your glowing cheeks (optional), and offer you a shot of whiskey.

Our spa is located in a shaded, private dome, at Hotel California on 7:15 and Guild. 

*Available on Tuesday and Thursday*

events.title: Meet the Artists Tour Broadcast on BMIR 94.5 FM
events.description: Coming at you directly from the Playa on BMIR - Burning Man Information Radio! An "unholy" alliance between the ARTery and BMIR, the Meet the Artist Broadcast will be hosted by Diablo, Dazzle! & G-Spot.    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ~There is a ton of AMAZING Art this year and we're gonna tell you about SOME of it, while interviewing a FEW of the incredible artists who dreamed it all up and created these fantastic works.  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ You can turn in to BMIR 94.5 FM while on the Playa, stream on-line worldwide at http://www.BMIR.org/ or (best of all) come follow the tour on your bike! Which Art Car to follow? None other than The Queen of BRC: "Christina" and Captain Flipper. Just look on the Esplanade near the ARTery/BMIR for a gorgeous 58' yacht with blue "waves" on her hull. http://bit.ly/ChristinaArtCar  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Have you ever stopped and wondered about some of the art out on the playa, and thought: "What the Fuck were they thinking!?!" Now you might just find out . . . All YOU have to do now on Thursday September 1st, 2016 just before 11:00 a.m. is remember to: TURN ON! ~Your radio TUNE IN! ~To 94.5 FM on the Playa (or stream on-line @ http://www.BMIR.org/) or DROP EVERYTHING ~You Dusty Burner & come follow us out into the desert on your bicycle . . . Thanks! Diablo

Our spa is located in a shaded, private dome, at Hotel California on 7:15 and Guild. 

*Available on Tuesday and Thursday*
events.print_description: Take a break from the playa dust, sun and sweat and come on in for a wonderful, relaxing 25-minute facial!

events.title: Garden State Burners Meet-Up
events.description:
Garden State Burners Welcomes our burner friends new and old from NJ and everywhere to join us at Nomads Of The East for a NJ Burner Meet-Up.

N.O.T.E. welcomes us into their beautiful home, with soft spaces to relax and connect, hookah for those interested, conversation and card games for those wish to. 
Hosted by New Jersey Regional Contact, Bryan Boru.

Due to non-placement, NOTE plans on being located at 8:40/H or somewhere nearby. Feel free to check the Directory at Center Camp for exact location. 
If there are any changes, NOTE will be doing their best to have signage directing you from the 8:30 & H intersection.

events.title: Hatha Yoga for Kids
events.description: Come on in for a really fun hour of gentle Hatha Yoga with cool sound effects to keep tiny humans interested!
events.print_description: Come on in for a really fun hour of gentle Hatha Yoga with cool sound effects to keep tiny humans interested!

events.title: Let's Nap!
events.description: It's Thursday afternoon and let's be real, you've slept less than 10 hours the past 4 days. Come enjoy a relaxing nap workshop in the Cosmic Ranch dome, free your mind and prepare for the epic weekend ahead. You'll be in the ultimate comfort of shade, cool mist, and beautiful people. Wake up slowly at your own pace, and be welcomed back to the world with a nice glass of cold champagne. See you in dream land
events.print_description: Come enjoy a relaxing nap workshop in the Cosmic Ranch dome, free your mind and prepare for the epic weekend ahead.

events.title: Playa Ballet
events.description: Come dance across the cosmos with Cosmic Ranch while incorporating the grace and strength of ballet! Our workshop will help you learn basic stances, body placement, and arm movements (port de bras) that are the basis of this art.
events.print_description: Come dance across the cosmos with Cosmic Ranch while incorporating the grace and strength of ballet!

events.title: Tequila Sunset
events.description: Cosmic Ranch blasts off its inaugural party on the playa with some margaritas and music to set you off into the moonlight right! We've got some resident DJs plus special guests that will make for one of your first sunsets on the playa spectacular!
events.print_description: Blast your week off at Cosmic Ranch's inaugural party on the playa with margaritas and music to set you off into the moonlight right!

events.title: Symposium: The Coming AI Apocalypse
events.description: This symposium will be introduced and moderated by a former NASA AI researcher, and is intended to explore the serious risk posed by the arrival of AIs whose intelligence far exceeds our own.  After the introduction, the symposium is open to participants discussion.
events.print_description: AI is coming and it could destroy us!  Come to the moderated symposium to further understand this problem, and discuss what to do.

events.title: Gourmet Sandwich Restaurant-Valhalla on the Playa
events.description: Valhalla on the Playa camp will be serving gourmet sandwiches at their sit-down restaurant starting at 1:00 pm until we run out of food. The restaurant will feature a full serving staff to make your dining experience memorable.
events.print_description: Valhalla on the Playa camp will be serving gourmet sandwiches at their sit-down restaurant starting at 1:00 pm until we run out of food

events.title: Craft cocktails at The Landing Strip, after sunset
events.description:
Come enjoy craft cocktails made by a former Florentine bartender.  Bring your flight- or travel-related kitsch, or show us your landing strip, or both!

Our steamy-eyed bartender will ask you three either-or questions that reveal your true self, then serve you one of 8 top-shelf cocktails accordingly.  You may overrule, but there will be consequences, such as body shots.

Share your hilarious or hair-raising stories of international travel.  We've been there and back again, have a billion of 'em.  Introduce yourself to the Captain and you might get to see the cockpit!

The party starts at sunset (around 7:40) and we'll be open at least an hour and a half.  Find us on Italic between 4 and 4:30.  In case we have to camp a block away, look for a sign with reflective tape indicating the vector for final approach.  BYOC.  See you there!
events.print_description: Our steamy-eyed Florentine barman will ask 3 questions, then serve a craft cocktail accordingly.  Travel themed, bring stories & your landing strip!

events.title: Female Ejaculation Exploration
events.description: Private instruction/coaching on g-spot massage and female ejaculation. Learn about what it is, how it works and the effects it has on healing the emotional body by releasing stored trauma, "negative" conditioning and deep seated stress. These sessions are private and pre-interview and appointment required.  Inquire at the information table in the chill tent.

events.title: Kat and Daley's Wedding
events.description:
Kat & Daley's Wedding // Celebrating a love about which books will be written and movies made. These two magic, magnetic puzzle pieces get even more glued with the support of friends old and new. All are welcome to join and share the love and dust!

Ocean Rows, Global Treks, Humanitarian trips & Start Up Adventures

Meet @Rumi'sTeaHouse 3:15&B, 5:15-5:30pm, have a tea ceremony at our camp then walk with us to the playa where we will have our official wedding, commitment, joining, love ceremony at approximately 6:30. Likely near the Temple, but that could change!

Wednesday and Friday afternoon.  Starts shortly after lunch and ends when the kegs are empty.  Bring your thirst, you cup, and your ID.

What pairs better than ice cold bowls of sugary cereal and some steamy espresso? Nothing! Nirvana at Buddha Camp. BringYourOwnBowl for karma points!

Everything from Froot Loops to Frosted Mini Wheats, Lucky Charms to granola. If you're hungry, hung over, home sick or just want to kick it with people who like cereal, come join the party!

Our barkeeps will keep the audience well lubricated, our hosts and hostesses will do their best to distract the speakers, and the string section out back will crank out the most banging tunes from the 17th century.

events.title: TEDx
events.description: Come to  TEDx BlackRockCity to be awed and inspired by a dozen 10' presentations covering such topics as adjusting to the digital age, dusting for the Thumbprint of God, probing whether memory is an illusion, looking at what’s coming in the emerging world of automation and developing our power to transform the world by connecting with others. In keeping with Burning Man’s guidelines, the entire lineup will not be announced until August 15. So stay tuned for further reports and regularly check www.tedxblackrockcity.com for updates on speakers and other details
events.print_description: A dozen 10' presentations by renowned entrepreneurs, artists, researchers. For the entire line-up stay tuned to www.tedxblackrockcity.com

events.title: Enchantment Under The Sea: 2nd Annual Salty Prom
events.description: By day Camp Salty is your favorite neighborhood dive bar, but on Wednesday night things will get naughty-cal. The central dance floor will transform into a sea of grooving bodies at the second annual Enchantment Under The Sea Party. You’ll enjoy our selection of craft cocktails at Salty Jack’s Oily Rig served up by the seamen and mermaids while DJs will be flooding the sound system with everything from midtempo breakbeat & electronic funk to classic soul, house & reggae. Join us for dancing until the chaperones turn the lights on.
events.print_description: The prom you always wanted to go to.

events.title: Kundalini tantra
events.description:
Kundalini tantra is designed to develop a greater awareness of the subtle energy in the body, strengthen the nervous system and correct any imbalances in the chakric system so that the primal energy known as kundalini may ascend through the spinal column activating every part of the brain and glandular system as it passes through the various chakras, illuminating the mind and bringing one into an expanded state of awareness and deeper sense of presence. We will begin with a mantra followed by basic warm ups to open up the energy channels in our bodies before we get into the main kriya. The purpose of the kriya we will be performing is to harmonize the masculine and feminine polarity within the body which will result in the experience of a more wholesome, integrated and balanced sense of self. 

 
Instructor: Joel Mueller. Joel is an artist and musician with a deep interest in the spiritual and philosophical traditions of this world. For the past 7 years he has practiced a form of yoga called Kundalini tantra through the guidance of his partner Adriane. She learned this method from Yogi Bhajan and has been teaching it for over 15 years.
events.print_description: Kundalini tantra is designed to develop a greater awareness of the subtle energy in the body and strengthen the nervous system.
